title: Applied Scientist
description:
**Applied Scientist** 




**Location:** 
 Bangalore / Hybrid
 



**Team:** 
 AI
 



  





**Role Overview** 




 We are seeking an
 **Applied AI Scientist** 
 to work on end\\-to\\-end applied research and build scalable AI systems using Machine Learning, Deep Learning, and Large Language Models (LLMs). This role focuses on transforming complex problems into practical, high\\-impact solutions through research, experimentation, and engineering.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities** 



* Design and execute applied research projects using ML, DL, and LLM techniques
* Collaborate with cross\\-functional teams to define open\\-ended problems and deliver data\\-driven solutions
* Develop, prototype, and optimize models on large\\-scale structured and unstructured datasets
* Contribute to internal research infrastructure, tools, and model deployment pipelines
* Stay up to date with advancements in AI research and industry best practices
* Translate research findings into reliable, production\\-ready systems



**What You‚Äôll Gain** 



* Exposure to real\\-world applied AI challenges with measurable impact
* Access to large datasets and high\\-performance computing resources
* A collaborative environment that values research rigor and innovation
* Opportunities for mentorship, knowledge sharing, and professional growth
* Support for publishing, open\\-source contributions, and external collaborations



**Qualifications** 



* PhD or Master‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Applied Mathematics, Statistics, Physics
* 3\\+ years of experience building ML, DL, RL, or LLM\\-based systems in research or industry
* Strong foundation in statistics, optimization, and numerical methods
* Experience with time\\-series modeling, NLP, or high\\-dimensional data
* Proficiency in Python and ML frameworks such as PyTorch, TensorFlow, JAX, or Hugging Face
* Familiarity with distributed training, MLOps practices, and version control (Git)
* Strong communication and collaboration skills



**Preferred Qualifications** 



* Publications in leading AI conferences (NeurIPS, ICML, ICLR, KDD, etc.)
* Experience working with large\\-scale or noisy datasets
* Background in applied research environments

title: Quality Assurance Engineer
description:
\\#AppianQA \\#AppianBPM \\#QualityAssurance \\#LowCode \\#AutomationTesting \\#TechHiring \\#AppianJobs
 



  





**Job Title:** 
 Appian QA Engineer
 



**Experience:** 
 4\\+ Years
 



**Work Mode:** 
 Remote
 



  





**Job Description** 




 We are seeking an experienced and detail\\-oriented
 **Appian QA Engineer** 
 with strong expertise in testing
 **Appian BPM applications** 
 . The role involves validating business process automation solutions built on the Appian low\\-code platform, ensuring high quality, performance, and reliability across releases with minimal supervision.
 



 The ideal candidate should have hands\\-on experience across the Appian application lifecycle and work effectively in Agile environments.
 



 Project Context
 



 This role supports enterprise Appian delivery initiatives by:
 



 ‚Ä¢ Ensuring quality assurance for Appian BPM and low\\-code solutions
 



 ‚Ä¢ Validating complex business workflows and integrations
 



 ‚Ä¢ Supporting UAT, production validation, and release sign\\-offs
 



 ‚Ä¢ Maintaining testing standards and QA best practices
 



**Key Responsibilities** 




 Appian Application Testing
 



 ‚Ä¢ Analyze business and functional requirements and prepare test scenarios and test cases
 



 ‚Ä¢ Perform functional, integration, system, regression, and UAT testing
 



 ‚Ä¢ Validate Appian components including process models, SAIL interfaces, records, rules, reports, sites, and CDTs
 



 ‚Ä¢ Test Appian application deployments, packages, and import/export processes
 



 Integration \\& API Testing
 



 ‚Ä¢ Test integrations with third\\-party systems using REST/SOAP APIs
 



 ‚Ä¢ Perform API testing using Postman or similar tools
 



 ‚Ä¢ Validate connected systems, plug\\-ins, and data exchanges
 



 Data \\& Performance Validation
 



 ‚Ä¢ Perform data validation using SQL on relational databases (Oracle, MySQL, SQL Server)
 



 ‚Ä¢ Support application performance and reliability testing
 



 ‚Ä¢ Assist in defect root\\-cause analysis
 



 Defect \\& Release Management
 



 ‚Ä¢ Log, track, and manage defects using JIRA or similar tools
 



 ‚Ä¢ Ensure timely defect resolution and proper closure
 



 ‚Ä¢ Support UAT cycles, production validation, and release sign\\-offs
 



 Collaboration \\& Documentation
 



 ‚Ä¢ Work closely with developers, business analysts, and product owners
 



 ‚Ä¢ Participate actively in Agile/Scrum ceremonies
 



 ‚Ä¢ Maintain test documentation, test reports, and quality metrics
 



 ‚Ä¢ Mentor junior QA team members and promote knowledge sharing
 



**Must\\-Have Skills (Mandatory)** 




 ‚Ä¢ 4\\+ years of experience in QA / Software Testing
 



 ‚Ä¢ Strong hands\\-on experience testing Appian BPM applications
 



 ‚Ä¢ Solid understanding of Appian architecture and application lifecycle
 



 ‚Ä¢ Experience testing Appian versions 21\\.x or later
 



 ‚Ä¢ Expertise in testing SAIL interfaces, process models, records, sites, CDTs, and reports
 



 ‚Ä¢ Strong experience in manual testing and test case design
 



 ‚Ä¢ Hands\\-on API testing experience (REST/SOAP)
 



 ‚Ä¢ Proficiency with SQL and relational databases
 



 ‚Ä¢ Experience working in Agile / Scrum environments
 



 ‚Ä¢ Strong defect management skills using JIRA or similar tools
 



**Core Skills** 




 ‚Ä¢ Appian BPM Testing
 



 ‚Ä¢ Manual Testing
 



 ‚Ä¢ SAIL Interfaces
 



 ‚Ä¢ Process Models \\& Workflows
 



 ‚Ä¢ REST / SOAP API Testing
 



 ‚Ä¢ SQL \\& Relational Databases
 



 ‚Ä¢ JIRA / Zephyr
 



 ‚Ä¢ Agile / Scrum
 



**Good to Have** 




 ‚Ä¢ Appian Level 1 or Level 2 Certification
 



 ‚Ä¢ Experience with test automation (Selenium, API automation, Appian testing tools)
 



 ‚Ä¢ Exposure to CI/CD pipelines (Jenkins, Git)
 



 ‚Ä¢ Performance testing experience

title: Software Development Engineer in Test (Mobile)
description:
**Department:** 
 Information Technology
   

  

**Location:** 
 APAC\\-India\\-IT Delivery Center Hyderabad
   

  

**Description**
**About the Role:**
 We are seeking a
 **SDET (Mobile)** 
 with strong expertise in mobile automation and quality engineering. The ideal candidate will be passionate about building reliable test automation frameworks for
 **iOS and Android apps** 
 , ensuring smooth releases with high quality and performance. As a senior member of the QE team, you will drive mobile test strategies, implement automation best practices, and mentor junior engineers.
   

  

**Role expectations**
**Key Responsibilities**
* Design, develop, and maintain mobile automation frameworks for Android and iOS (Appium, Espresso, XCUITest, or similar).
* Create and execute automated test scripts for UI, functional, regression, and end\\-to\\-end testing.
* Collaborate closely with developers, product managers, and QA engineers to define test strategies, acceptance criteria, and automation coverage.
* Integrate automated tests into CI/CD pipelines (Jenkins, GitHub Actions, GitLab CI, Azure DevOps, etc.).
* Ensure cross\\-platform compatibility and device coverage through device farms (BrowserStack, Lambda test etc).
* Conduct performance and stability testing for mobile apps (JMeter, Gatling, Firebase Performance, Xcode Instruments, Android Profiler).
* Debug issues, perform root cause analysis, and work with developers to deliver high\\-quality releases.
* Mentor junior SDETs and QE engineers, reviewing their code and ensuring adherence to best practices.
* Stay up to date with emerging tools, frameworks, and trends in mobile automation and quality engineering.


**What We're Looking For**
**Required Skills \\& Qualifications**
* 5\\+ years of experience in Mobile automation (iOS and Android)
* Strong programming skills in Java, Kotlin, Swift, or Python.
* Hands\\-on experience with mobile automation frameworks (Appium, Espresso, XCUITest, Detox, etc.).
* Experience in CI/CD integration of mobile automation tests.
* Good understanding of mobile development ecosystem (Android Studio, Xcode, Gradle, Fastlane).
* Familiarity with device farms for cross\\-device testing.
* Solid grasp of QA methodologies, Agile processes, and SDLC.
* Excellent debugging, problem\\-solving, and analytical skills.


**Personal Attributes**
* Adaptive and quick learner ‚Äì able to adjust to new tools, technologies, and processes with ease.
* Collaborative mindset ‚Äì works well in a team, shares knowledge, and helps others grow.
* Ownership\\-driven ‚Äì takes accountability for work and delivers with high quality.
* Strong communication skills ‚Äì clear, concise, and proactive in interactions with peers and stakeholders.


**Good to Have**
* Knowledge of API testing (RestAssured, Postman, Karate, or similar) to validate mobile backend services.
* Knowledge of mobile security testing and compliance best practices.
* Experience with mobile performance testing \\& monitoring (Firebase Performance, Crashlytics, Xcode Instruments, Android Profiler).
* Exposure to cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure) for mobile app deployments.


**Applicant Privacy Policy**
 Review our
 **Applicant Privacy Policy** 
 for additional information.
   

  

**Equal Opportunity Statement**
 Align Technology is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunities in all our practices, without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, marital status, protected veteran status, age, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other legally protected category. title: Sr Software Engineer
description:
**Job Overview** 




  





 As a Senior Software Engineer at Uniphore, you will be integral to the development and enhancement of data platform that are at the core of our product offerings. You will collaborate with cross\\-functional teams of engineers, and product managers to build scalable, reliable, and high\\-performance software systems.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities** 



* Create a scalable and robust platform for data engineering across multiple cloud providers.
* Design and implement applications leveraging distributed technologies like Spark, Databricks, and BigQuery.
* Design, develop and implement AI applications, staying updated on advancements in AI technology, and contributing to the company's AI strategy.
* Write clean, maintainable, and efficient code, ensuring alignment with best practices in software engineering.
* Participate in the full software development lifecycle, including requirements gathering, design, testing, and release.
* Troubleshoot, debug, and optimize existing software to improve performance, reliability, and scalability in a cloud\\-based environment.
* Collaborate with cross\\-functional teams (AI/ML, product, UX) to translate business and customer needs into technical solutions.
* Ensure adherence to security and data privacy standards in AI\\-driven applications, particularly when handling sensitive customer data.
* Implement and maintain CI/CD pipelines, ensuring smooth deployment and version control for software components.



  





**Required Skills and Experience** 



* Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or equivalent.
* 4\\-7 years of software development experience.
* Strong proficiency in Java, Python and API development.
* Experience with any of the frameworks \\- Spring Boot, Vertx
* Expertise in databases like Postgres, MongoDB, or MySQL.
* Experience with cloud platforms like AWS, GCP, or Azure.
* Exceptional problem\\-solving abilities and programming skills.
* Familiarity with software engineering best practices including version control, code review, and test driven architecture.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
* Motivated to thrive in a startup environment.



  





**Preferred Skills** 



* Proficiency in Spark or Managed Spark like Dataproc and Databricks.
* Familiarity with Airflow.
* Familiarity with Cloud Data Warehouses like Snowflake or BigQuery.
* Familiarity with Javascript or Typescript.
* Familiarity with containers and Kubernetes.
* Proficiency in Devops tools like Jenkins and CI/CD workflows.
* Knowledge of basic linux commands.
* Previous experience in AI research, development, or implementation projects.

title: Lead Backend Developer
description:
**About Us** 





 We're building the next generation of smart calculators for modern retailers ‚Äî tools that go far beyond basic math. These devices integrate dynamic QR code generation, digital payments, inventory tracking, and more. Think of it as a POS terminal disguised as a calculator ‚Äî but way smarter.
 





 ¬†Our mission is simple yet ambitious: to replace over 30 million traditional calculators sitting on shop counters across the world. If you're passionate about creating intuitive, impactful hardware \\+ software systems that empower everyday users ‚Äî join us in redefining what a calculator can do.
 




  





**About the Job** 





 We are looking for a hands\\-on¬†
 
**Backend Lead Engineer** 

 ¬†to own, scale, and optimize the backend systems powering our next\\-generation smart calculator ecosystem. This role involves leading backend architecture, mentoring engineers, and building robust services that support payments, IoT device sync, inventory, and real\\-time retail workflows.
 





 The ideal candidate enjoys designing large\\-scale distributed systems, writing clean and reliable backend code, and working closely with cross\\-functional teams across firmware, app, and DevOps. This role is ideal for engineers who want deep ownership, architectural influence, and the opportunity to shape the technical foundation of a fast\\-growing product.
 




  





**Key Responsibilities** 




**Backend Architecture \\& Development** 



* Design and develop scalable backend services using Java/Kotlin and Spring Boot.
* Build and maintain APIs for payments, inventory, device sync, and retail workflows.
* Optimize system performance, database queries, and API latency for real\\-world usage.
* Lead architectural decisions in collaboration with the CTO and Engineering Manager.



  





**Technical Leadership \\& Mentorship** 



* Guide backend engineers on best practices, design patterns, and system design.
* Conduct code reviews, ensure code quality, and maintain engineering standards.
* Support team members in debugging complex backend issues and production incidents.



  





**Cross\\-Functional Collaboration** 



* Work closely with the Mobile App team to define API contracts and data flows.
* Collaborate with Hardware \\& Firmware teams to design device communication protocols.
* Coordinate with DevOps on infrastructure, deployments, monitoring, and CI/CD.



  





**System Reliability \\& Operations** 



* Own critical production systems, including incident response and root\\-cause analysis.
* Implement logging, monitoring, and observability practices across services.
* Ensure backend readiness for 10x scale and multi\\-region deployments.



  





**Required Skills** 



* Strong proficiency in Java/Kotlin with deep experience in Spring Boot.
* Hands\\-on experience designing and scaling distributed backend systems.
* Solid understanding of PostgreSQL, DynamoDB, caching, and queueing systems.
* Experience working with AWS services such as EKS, EC2, RDS, S3, and Lambda.
* Familiarity with Docker, CI/CD pipelines, and cloud\\-native deployments.
* Strong grasp of system design fundamentals (scalability, reliability, fault tolerance).
* Ability to debug complex production issues in distributed environments.
* Strong communication and collaboration skills across technical and non\\-technical teams



  





**Qualifications** 



* 7‚Äì10\\+ years of backend engineering experience, including team or project leadership.
* Demonstrated experience owning production systems at scale..



  





**Optional / Nice\\-to\\-Have Skills** 



* Experience with Python and FastAPI for microservices.
* Background in FinTech or payment gateway integrations.
* Exposure to IoT or device synchronization systems.
* Experience scaling systems from early\\-stage to high\\-traffic production systems.
* Contributions to open\\-source or technical writing.

description:
***We are seeking an experienced Integration Engineer with strong hands\\-on experience using Workato to build, maintain, and optimize integrations across enterprise systems. The ideal candidate will have integration experience with applications i.e, NetSuite, Salesforce etc. along with deep understanding of APIs, automation workflows, and data transformation.  Develop API integrations, manage data transformations (ETL), ensure data security, and handle authentication (REST, SOAP, JSON).
 



**Monitoring \\& Maintenance:** 
 Proactively monitor existing integrations, troubleshoot issues, perform root cause analysis, and optimize performance.

**Innovation:** 
 Explore new integration technologies and implement AI/RPA solutions for process enhancement.

 Hands\\-on Workato experience (recipes, connectors, workflows).

 Thanks \\& Regards,
 



 Chandrashekhar Rao

title: Test Automation Lead ‚Äì UI +API
description:
At Lilly, we unite caring with discovery to make life better for people around the world. We are a global healthcare leader headquartered in Indianapolis, Indiana. Our employees around the world work to discover and bring life\\-changing medicines to those who need them, improve the understanding and management of disease, and give back to our communities through philanthropy and volunteerism. We give our best effort to our work, and we put people first. We‚Äôre looking for people who are determined to make life better for people around the world.
   

  

 Are you passionate about leveraging technology to automate and transform business processes? Do you have a deep understanding of test automation and a desire to drive innovation in enterprise systems? If so, the Tech@Lilly Enterprise Test Automation team invites you to apply for the role of Test Automation Lead.
   

  

 As a key Test Automation Lead, you will be responsible for driving the quality and reliability of automation solutions across the enterprise. In this role, you will work closely with functional IT teams to gain a deep understanding of their domains and applications, providing technical consultation, contributing to automation architecture design, and leading initial setup activities to enable effective test automation Are you innovative and curious about new technology that can make business processes easier and more efficient? Come join our team
   

  

**Automation in Software Testing**
 Lilly‚Äôs mission is to develop and maintain software products that meet the needs and requirements of both our internal and external customers. This typically involves a combination of activities such as gathering and analysing user requirements, designing, and implementing software solutions, testing and debugging code, and maintaining and improving the performance and reliability of the software over time. The goal of software engineering at Lilly is to create high\\-quality, reliable, and effective software utilizing cutting edge methodologies and integrations to solve Lilly‚Äôs real\\-world problems and provide value to our customers.
   

  

 At Lilly, our Technology Enablement initiatives‚Äîparticularly within the Enterprise Test Automation Centre of Excellence (TACoE)‚Äîare designed to leverage modern tools and practices to enhance the quality, speed, and reliability of software delivery. We are committed to embedding automated testing into the core of our engineering processes, enabling innovation, reducing manual effort, and delivering sustainable value to our operations and customers.
   

  

 As an Enterprise Test Automation Lead, you will play a pivotal role in driving the adoption of cutting\\-edge test automation frameworks, fostering a culture of continuous integration and deployment, and guiding teams across the enterprise to achieve robust, scalable, and efficient test automation practices.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Hands\\-on experience with API testing tools such as Postman and REST Assured, and performance testing tools such as k6, LoadRunner, and JMeter.
* Analyze API responses, logs, and performance metrics to validate data consistency, accuracy, and system behaviour.
* Strong experience in Functional, UI, API, and Performance Testing.
* Proficiency in JavaScript testing frameworks such as Cypress and Playwright.
* Experience with BDD frameworks, particularly Cucumber.
* Serve as a liaison across various Tech@Lilly functional areas to promote and support enterprise\\-wide test automation initiatives.
* Lead and mentor a diverse team of Engineers to rapidly initiate and scale test automation efforts.
* Lead consultation on test automation tools, solution fit, and best practices.
* Champion an ‚Äúautomation\\-first‚Äù mindset in test execution strategies and software delivery.
* Develop deep technical expertise in test automation platforms and industry best practices to drive innovation and continuous improvement.
* Align people, tools, and processes to enable rapid and reusable automation solutions across the enterprise.
* Continuously evaluate and validate emerging automation tools and technologies to ensure Lilly remains at the forefront of innovation.
* Collaborate with the Test Automation Architect to ensure platform stability, security, performance, and scalability.
* Partner with peers to define and maintain automation metrics and KPIs, including dashboards and automated reporting.
* Work closely with delivery teams to anticipate demand, plan capacity, and ensure timely project execution.
* Act as a consulting partner to functional teams, identifying automation opportunities and guiding the implementation of scalable, sustainable test automation strategies.
* Serve in a techno\\-functional role, collaborating with various functional areas and the Enterprise Test Automation team to bridge gaps and ensure effective automation solutions.


  

  

**Qualifications**
* Bachelor‚Äôs degree in computer science, Information Technology, or a related field.
* 8\\+ years of relevant experience in the field
* Proven experience as a technical leader, with the ability to influence strategic direction and drive implementation across multiple projects.
* Extensive hands\\-on experience in software testing and test automation tools and technologies.
* Proficiency in various testing types: functional, integration, regression, mobile, data, cross\\-platform, component, security, and UI/UX testing.
* Strong understanding of hybrid cloud and cloud\\-native architectures, integration strategies, and security considerations.
* Demonstrated ability to build relationships, lead diverse teams, and drive operational improvements.
* Should have experience with stakeholder management, influencing without authority, relationship management
* Should have experience leading testing teams in executing large scale test plans for complex systems
* Provide technical leadership and mentorship to team members, fostering a culture of continuous improvement.
* Exposure to Power BI, Splunk, or similar monitoring/reporting tools.
* Candidate should have prior experience working in the pharmaceutical or life sciences domain.


**Preferred Skills**
* Excellent analytical, problem\\-solving, and communication skills.
* High intellectual and technical curiosity with a passion for continuous improvement and innovation.
* Experience with Agile methodologies such as Scrum, Kanban, and SAFe.
* Skilled in Python scripting for automation and testing tasks.
* Experience with AWS or other cloud platforms.
* Design, develop, and maintain robust automated test frameworks for web, mobile, and API layers to support CI/CD pipelines.
* Collaborate with developers, product owners, and DevOps teams to ensure test coverage, traceability, and defect resolution.
* Drive best practices in test automation strategy, shift\\-left testing, and continuous quality improvement.


 Lilly is dedicated to helping individuals with disabilities to actively engage in the workforce, ensuring equal opportunities when vying for positions. If you require accommodation to submit a resume for a position at Lilly, please complete the accommodation request form (https://careers.lilly.com/us/en/workplace\\-accommodation) for further assistance. Please note this is for individuals to request an accommodation as part of the application process and any other correspondence will not receive a response.
   

  

 Lilly does not discriminate on the basis of age, race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, protected veteran status, disability or any other legally protected status.

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
We stared Pinky Promise because we just got tired of our own healthcare experiences. Women's healthcare is broken and there has to be a better way. Join us to build it. We are looking for a software engineer to join a small, but insanely fun team in Mumbai that is dedicated to¬†ensure that every single woman in India has instant, quality and uplifting gynecological care \\- on her own terms.¬†
 



  





 Pinky Promise is a digital clinic where a women can connect with a Gynaecologist, describe her issue, get a prescription in mins and stay connected till she feels better \\- for just 99RS.¬†We have build a medical AI system that works alongside the Doctor to make this all possible.¬†In two years we have become the most downloaded women's health app in the country and helped 300,000\\+ women in India (largely from Tier2/3 cities). In the next year we will impact the lives of 1M women.¬†https://www.askpinkypromise.com/
 



  





 Location: Mumbai,¬†In Office¬†
 



 Salary: Negotiable based on experience
 



  





**What you will do in the next 18 months:** 




 1\\. Scale up our platform to serve 1 Million users without a glitch.¬†
 



 2\\. Build a first\\-of\\-its\\-kind medical AI that is designed specifically for women's healthcare.¬†
 



 3\\.¬†Work across products and technologies, including backend microservices and customer facing apps on web and mobile.¬†
 



 4\\. Design and build key features of the product to fundamentally change how women access reproductive healthcare and take care of themselves.¬†
 



 5\\. Work closely with the founding team, contributing to the design and development of cutting\\-edge AI solutions that will transform women's healthcare.¬†
 



  





**Who Are You:** 




 You are someone who is comfortable working across different technologies, is excited about learning new things everyday, and is ready to change the status quo for women's healthcare.
 



 1\\. Proficiency in any one programming language such as Python, (Javascript) Nodejs, Java, Rust, or Go.
 



 2\\. Experience with designing and developing RESTful APIs and microservices using frameworks like Django, Flask, Spring Boot, Express, etc.
 



 3\\. Experience¬† in web and/or mobile app development with languages/frameworks such as Kotlin, Swift, React Native, Flutter, Vue, React¬†
 



 4\\. Understanding of database systems (SQL/NoSQL) and proficiency in writing efficient queries.
 



 5\\. Familiarity with cloud platforms like AWS or GCP and experience with related services and experience with version control systems (e.g., Git)¬†
 



 5\\.Completely self driven. Strong problem\\-solving skills and attention to detail. Excellent communication and collaboration skills.¬†
 



  





**Education / Experience:** 




 Master‚Äôs degree in Computer Science or related fields with 2\\+ years experience OR 5\\-8 years experience in a core dev role.

title: Test Automation - Database Expert
description:
At Lilly, we unite caring with discovery to make life better for people around the world. We are a global healthcare leader headquartered in Indianapolis, Indiana. Our employees around the world work to discover and bring life\\-changing medicines to those who need them, improve the understanding and management of disease, and give back to our communities through philanthropy and volunteerism. We give our best effort to our work, and we put people first. We‚Äôre looking for people who are determined to make life better for people around the world.
   

  

 Are you passionate about leveraging technology to automate and transform business processes?
   

  

 Do you have a deep understanding of test automation and a desire to drive innovation in enterprise systems?
   

  

 If so, the Enterprise Automation team at Tech@Lilly is looking for a Lead Consultant in Test Automation to help scale our automation capabilities and quality practices across the organization.
   

  

 As a Test Lead consultant in Test Automation, you will be responsible for driving the quality and reliability of automation solutions across the enterprise. In this role, you will work closely with Engineers and cross\\-functional teams throughout the full application lifecycle‚Äîensuring that systems are thoroughly tested, resilient, and aligned with business needs from development through to production.
   

  

 Are you innovative and curious about new technology that can make business processes easy and more efficient? Come join our team!
   

  

**What You‚Äôll Be Doing**
 As a
 **Lead Consultant** 
 you will play a pivotal role in shaping and advancing the company‚Äôs enterprise\\-wide automation strategy. You will leverage both your technical expertise and leadership capabilities to oversee the delivery of scalable, high\\-quality automation solutions. Your responsibilities will include driving resolution of complex testing challenges, leading the implementation of critical enhancements, and spearheading modernization initiatives to ensure our automation frameworks and practices are future\\-ready and aligned with business objectives.
   

  

**How You‚Äôll Succeed**
* Drive Strategic Quality Initiatives: Align automation goals with enterprise objectives, ensuring that testing solutions directly support business outcomes and deliver measurable value.
* Lead with Influence: Inspire and guide cross\\-functional teams by promoting a culture of quality, innovation, and continuous improvement in testing practices.
* Deliver Scalable Solutions: Architect and implement automation frameworks that are robust, maintainable, and adaptable to evolving technologies and platforms.
* Foster Collaboration: Partner effectively with development, DevOps, product, and business teams to integrate testing into every phase of the software development lifecycle.
* Champion Modernization: Evaluate emerging tools, trends, and technologies to modernize testing processes and improve speed, reliability, and test coverage.
* Ensure Quality at Speed: Establish metrics and KPIs to monitor automation performance, reduce manual effort, and accelerate release cycles without compromising quality.
* Mentor and Uplift Teams: Share expertise and best practices to build testing competency across teams, nurturing the next generation of automation engineers.


**What You Should Bring**

+ UI and functional testing: Protractor, Cypress, Playwright
+ AI testing : MABL
+ API testing: Postman
+ Performance testing: k6, JMeter
+ Mobile testing: Appium for iOS and Android
+ BDD frameworks: Cucumber, SpecFlow

* Provide insights and recommendations to improve ETL design, performance, and reliability, ensuring alignment with business and compliance requirements.
* Leverage SQL or different database, Python, and automation tools to optimize testing efficiency and support continuous integration pipelines.
* Act as an ETL Testing subject matter expert, responsible for validating data movement, transformation, and integration across multiple systems.
* Proficiency in various testing types: functional, integration, regression, mobile, data, security, component, and UI/UX testing.
* Practical experience in developing test solutions using programming/scripting languages such as JavaScript.
* Define, implement, and own test strategies across enterprise\\-level projects and programs.
* Lead and mentor global and cross\\-functional QA teams, promoting best practices and continuous improvement.
* Collaborate with senior leadership, product owners, architects, and development teams to ensure quality is built into all stages of the development lifecycle.
* Drive the implementation of test automation strategies and continuous testing practices.
* Identify test process improvement opportunities and lead initiatives to enhance QA maturity and efficiency
